title: Beyond Zork: The Coconut of Quendor

children.title: About

child.title: About PRIZM Invisiclues
child.content:
The PRIZM project (Pretty Reliable Invisiclues for Z-Machine) resulted from a collaboration between Digby McWiggle (digby_mcwiggle@hotmail.com) and Steven Marsh (marsh@netally.com, www.waitingforgo.com), with the aim of making the genuine Infocom invisiclues available as Z-Code computer files. The project was endorsed by Activision, who now hold the copyright for Infocom's material.

Whenever possible we have stayed faithful to the original printed Invisiclues booklets. Where both in-game and printed versions were available we have used the printed clues, as these were generally more detailed. Printing errors have been corrected whenever possible. The files have been formatted to display correctly on any screen with a width of at least 80 characters.

The home of the PRIZM project is www.waitingforgo.com. There you can download different versions of the files, with or without sample transcripts and missing documentation, and grouped by various classifications (unfortunately, limitations within the Z-Machine prevent all the invisiclues being packaged into one big file).

children.title: Sample Question

child.title: Sample Question

children.title: There's a bird nearby with a jewel in its beak. How can I get it?

child.title: There's a bird nearby with a jewel in its beak. How can I get it?
hints: You can't catch the bird, but you can make it drop the jewel.
What do birds like to eat?
TAKE THE WORM FROM THE FISHERMAN. If you then DROP THE WORM, the bird will drop the jewel.

children.title: Grubbo-by-the-Sea

child.title: Grubbo-by-the-Sea

children.title: Why can't I talk to the old sailor?

child.title: Why can't I talk to the old sailor?
hints: Perhaps he's a bit hard of hearing.
YELL AT THE SAILOR.
Oh, well. You don't need to talk to him anyway.

children.title: What's the significance of the sailor's painting?

child.title: What's the significance of the sailor's painting?
hints: You'll find out, if you live long enough.

children.title: How do I get the driftwood out of the water?

child.title: How do I get the driftwood out of the water?
hints: Easy. Just GET THE DRIFTWOOD OUT OF THE WATER.

children.title: What's a shillelagh?

child.title: What's a shillelagh?
hints: EXAMINE THE SHILLELAGH.
"Shillelagh" is an Irish word for a cudgel.
A cudgel is a club for bashing things.

children.title: A leprechaun stole my shillelagh! How do I get it back?

child.title: A leprechaun stole my shillelagh! How do I get it back?
hints: EXAMINE THE RAINBOW. It may hold a clue to the thief's whereabouts.
LOOK UNDER THE POT OF GOLD.
Rainbow? Pot of gold?
Remember the warning in the introduction! Don't let the presence or absence of questions influence your play, and don't assume that long answers are associated with important questions.

children.title: What's the significance of the sign outside the tavern?

child.title: What's the significance of the sign outside the tavern?
hints: Read the room description again, carefully.
Part of the sign is made of a real lantern.
TAKE THE LANTERN OFF THE HOOK. You'll be glad you did.

children.title: How do I get into the tavern?

child.title: How do I get into the tavern?
hints: Just GO INTO THE TAVERN. (Make sure you OPEN THE FRONT DOOR first.)

children.title: One of the bandits threw a dagger at me! What should I do?

child.title: One of the bandits threw a dagger at me! What should I do?
hints: Relax. They're just amusing themselves.
Besides, there may be something in it for you.
PULL THE DAGGER OUT OF THE WALL. It might come in handy later.

children.title: Why won't the cook let me take the giant onion?

child.title: Why won't the cook let me take the giant onion?
hints: Why should he? It's his onion. He may be willing to trade for it, though.
ASK THE COOK ABOUT THE GIANT ONION.
After you retrieve the wine bottle, GIVE THE BOTTLE TO THE COOK. Now you can ROLL THE ONION in any direction you like.

children.title: How do I get into the wine cellar?

child.title: How do I get into the wine cellar?
hints: There's a door leading downward.
OPEN THE CELLAR DOOR. GO DOWN THE STAIRS.

children.title: The Wine Cellar

child.title: The Wine Cellar

children.title: The Lore and Legends of Quendor doesn't say anything about rat-ants!

child.title: The Lore and Legends of Quendor doesn't say anything about rat-ants!
hints: Take heart. The Rat-Ant's Cookbook says plenty about peasants.
Rat-ants, though small, can be quite deadly. Fight back!

children.title: What do I do with the crinkly scroll?

child.title: What do I do with the crinkly scroll?
hints: READ THE SCROLL. It may give you a clue.
If strange, flowing runes are inscribed across the top of the scroll, skip ahead to the next question.
The strange word on the scroll is its Word of Power.
To invoke a scroll's Magick, you must speak its Word of Power. For example, if the scroll's word is "Foo," type SAY "FOO" or just FOO.

children.title: I can't read the runes on a scroll! What's going on?

child.title: I can't read the runes on a scroll! What's going on?
hints: Your character's intelligence isn't high enough to read this scroll.
You must either find a way to improve your character's intelligence, or RESTART the story with a smarter character.

children.title: I spoke the Word on the crinkly scroll. What happened?

child.title: I spoke the Word on the crinkly scroll. What happened?
hints: The "refreshing pink aura" that surrounded you when you spoke the Word also surrounded your possessions.
EXAMINE the items you were holding when you read the scroll.

The crinkly scroll is a Scroll of Refreshment. If you're holding the rusty lantern when you read this scroll, the lantern now "looks good as new," and you'll find that it lasts much longer. The rusty dagger is also renewed and sharpened by the scroll.
Other items can be affected by the Scroll of Refreshment. Experiment!

children.title: My scroll disappeared! How do I get it back?

child.title: My scroll disappeared! How do I get it back?
hints: You don't. Ever. So forget it.

children.title: How do I see in the dark?

child.title: How do I see in the dark?
hints: You need a source of light.
Remember the name of the tavern upstairs?
Remember that sign outside the tavern?
Remember the rusty lantern hanging on that sign outside the tavern?
You'll need that lantern to survive in the wine cellar. Next time, remember to read room descriptions carefully, and try to TAKE everything that isn't nailed down.

children.title: I just found a wand (stick, rod, stave, cane or staff)! How do I use it?

child.title: I just found a wand (stick, rod, stave, cane or staff)! How do I use it?
hints: Just point it at the thing you want to affect.

children.title: How do I get the tiny crown from the discipline crab?

child.title: How do I get the tiny crown from the discipline crab?
hints: He's not likely to give it up without a fight.
ATTACK THE DISCIPLINE CRAB If you win, he'll drop the crown.

children.title: Can I do anything with the pile of seashells?

child.title: Can I do anything with the pile of seashells?
hints: SEARCH THE PILE. There may be something interesting within.

children.title: Why can't I climb the stack of crates?

child.title: Why can't I climb the stack of crates?
hints: Not very coordinated, are you?
Coordination is related to dexterity.
Your character's dexterity isn't high enough to climb the stack. You must either find a way to improve your character's dexterity, or RESTART the story with a more dexterous character.
Something in the cellar can help you increase your dexterity.
Read The Lore and Legends of Quendor.
One of the rooms in the wine cellar has moss on the walls.
The "Moss of Mareilon" entry in Lore and Legends explains how you can use the moss to improve your dexterity.
Be patient. It takes a few moves for the moss to take effect.

children.title: My lantern keeps going out. Where can I recharge it?

child.title: My lantern keeps going out. Where can I recharge it?
hints: Bring it to the nearest hardware store. (Too bad there aren't any hardware stores in this part of Quendor.) The crinkly scroll can serve the same purpose, though.
Refer to the questions about the crinkly scroll for more clues.

children.title: Help! A skeleton is strangling me!

child.title: Help! A skeleton is strangling me!
hints: The slightest defense is enough to defeat the skeleton.
KICK THE SKELETON. Preferably before he kills you.

children.title: How do I decipher the runes on the amulet?

child.title: How do I decipher the runes on the amulet?
hints: Something about the runes makes them different from the swirls and flourishes.
It's their color.
Magick can't help you here, but perhaps Science can.
Specifically, the Science of Optics.
A color filter might help you distinguish the green runes from the red swirls and flourishes.
Something in the cellar can be used as a red color filter.
It's the bottle of wine.
LOOK AT THE AMULET THROUGH THE WINE BOTTLE. The red, transparent liquid will mask out the red swirls enough for you to read the green runes.

children.title: Of what use is the amulet?

child.title: Of what use is the amulet?
hints: It makes a nice necklace. PUT ON THE AMULET.
While wearing the amulet, speak the Word of Power inscribed upon it.
(See the previous question on how to read the amulet.) For even more fun, type STATUS before you speak the amulet's Word.
Be warned! The extra strength lasts only a few moves. Also, you can only invoke the amulet's Magick three times.

children.title: How do I get back upstairs out of the cellar?

child.title: How do I get back upstairs out of the cellar?
hints: If you had a key, maybe you could unlock the door. Unfortunately, there are no keys to be found. Looks as if you'll have to break the door down.
You'd have to be pretty strong to break down that door.
It's unlikely that any character you would create would be strong enough to do the job.
Luckily, there's something magical in the wine cellar that can help.
PUT ON THE AMULET and speak the Word of Power inscribed upon it. (See previous two questions.) This should boost your strength enough to BREAK DOWN THE CELLAR DOOR.

(If your character's strength isn't high enough, you must either find a way to improve it, or RESTART the story with a stronger character.) There are three other magical ways out of the cellar, but you might not yet have the magic items needed.
The Wand of Sayonara will also get you out. You want to teleport yourself, so POINT THE WAND OF SAYONARA AT MYSELF.
The scroll of Recall will transport you out, but only if you've said its Word of Power elsewhere. Speaking the Word of Power a second time will return you to where it was first spoken.
The scroll of Gating (the palimpsest) will also save you. Just hold the palimpsest and speak its Word of Power.

children.title: I saved my game just before I entered the wine cellar. When I restored and went down again, the geography was different! What's going on?

child.title: ...and went down again, the geography was different! What's going on?
hints: The wine cellar is one of several "regions" in the story which are randomly generated the first time you enter them. The geography isn't the only thing that varies; the names of magic items and the locations of treasures and monsters may also differ. Once you enter a region, its attributes remain constant for the remainder of the story.

children.title: The Lighthouse

child.title: The Lighthouse

children.title: What's the meaning of the inscription on the cliff wall?

child.title: What's the meaning of the inscription on the cliff wall?
hints: It's a riddle.
A dictionary might help you find the answer.
Forks have tines. "Ere" means "before." The word "report" has many meanings.
Don't develop the next hint unless you're really stumped.
Type the word LIGHTNING and watch what happens.

children.title: That giant slug is tough! Anything I can do to improve my odds?

child.title: That giant slug is tough! Anything I can do to improve my odds?
hints: You don't need to defeat the slug to complete the story.
Bloodthirsty, eh? Well, if fighting, Magick or running away don't work, there is an alternative.
Chemical warfare.
Slugs are notoriously sensitive to a certain common substance.
That substance is salt.
There's a patch of brine at the Tidal Flats near the lighthouse.
Go to the Tidal Flats and GET SOME SALT. Then return to the lighthouse and HURL THE SALT AT THE GIANT SLUG.

children.title: How do I get the dust bunny?

child.title: How do I get the dust bunny?
hints: Just PICK UP THE DUST BUNNY.
Prolific, aren't they?
You can't take any of the dust bunnies. But you'll have to get rid of them to complete the story.

children.title: These dust bunnies are driving me nuts! What do I do?

child.title: These dust bunnies are driving me nuts! What do I do?
hints: Read The Lore and Legends of Quendor.
There are no lemon-scented sprays to be found in this story.
There is an excellent source of static electricity, though.
It's in the tavern.
It's the bearskin rug lying on the floor.
See what happens when you WALK ACROSS THE BEARSKIN RUG.
Try touching something after you walk across the rug.
Bring the rug to the room with dust bunnies. PUT DOWN THE RUG THEN WALK ACROSS IT. TOUCH A DUST BUNNY.
Don't forget to PICK UP THE RING. You'll need it later.

children.title: Is there any way to get rid of the dornbeast?

child.title: Is there any way to get rid of the dornbeast?
hints: You can fight the dornbeast, but you're not likely to survive. Only the most powerful Magick can destroy him. That dorn is tough ... but not invulnerable.
Read The Lore and Legends of Quendor.
Have you studied the illustration of the dornbeast?
The dornbeast has 69 sensitive eyes.
There's an object in the game which can wreak havoc on sensitive eyes.
It's in the tavern.
It's the giant onion in the kitchen.

Roll the giant onion into the Lamphouse. CUT THE GIANT ONION WITH THE DAGGER (or any other sharp weapon). This will inconvenience the dornbeast long enough for you to GET THE SEA CHEST and scram! (Refer to a previous question if you can't take the giant onion.) You don't need to kill the dornbeast, but if you want to get maximum experience in the story (for more endurance) you can repeatedly cut the onion and attack the dornbeast while he's disabled by the onion.
Alternately, POINT THE WAND (or whatever) OF ANNIHILATION AT THE DORNBEAST.

children.title: Is there anything in the debris besides the chest?

child.title: Is there anything in the debris besides the chest?
hints: SEARCH THE DEBRIS.
The sextant you find is a valuable treasure.

children.title: How do I open the sea chest?

child.title: How do I open the sea chest?
hints: Easy. Just OPEN THE CHEST.
Relax. Pay attention to everything the stallion tells you.
And don't open that chest again!

children.title: What on earth can I do with a vague outline?

child.title: What on earth can I do with a vague outline?
hints: Nothing... on earth.
The old woman at the Magick Shoppe may be able to tell you.
Have you brought the outline to another plane of existence?
Have you examined the palimpsest?
Have you discovered the palimpsest's Word of Power?
While holding the vague outline, speak the Word of Power inscribed upon the palimpsest.
Check your inventory. The outline has changed.

children.title: What is a palimpsest?

child.title: What is a palimpsest?
hints: A palimpsest is a writing surface (in this case, a scroll) which has been erased and reused.
The palimpsest is the only scroll in the story which can be reused.

children.title: The Ethereal Plane of Atrii

child.title: The Ethereal Plane of Atrii

children.title: Where am I?

child.title: Where am I?
hints: Read The Lore and Legends of Quendor. Look under the entry on Implementors.

children.title: An outline is blocking my path!

child.title: An outline is blocking my path!
hints: Whack it with something!
Ordinary weapons don't seem to work here.
You need an extraordinary weapon.
It's the vague outline.
The outline isn't so vague on the Plane of Atrii.

children.title: What are these curtains doing here?

child.title: What are these curtains doing here?
hints: Just hanging around.
Do they remind you of any other locations in the story?
Each of the shops (in Accardi, Mizniaport and Gurth) has a curtain.
WALK THROUGH THE CURTAIN. Convenient, eh?

children.title: Is there anything I can do with the Implementors?

child.title: Is there anything I can do with the Implementors?
hints: Pay attention.
Follow orders.
Rejoice in your good fortune! Few indeed are those lucky enough to witness an Implementors' Lunch.

children.title: Accardi-by-the-Sea

child.title: Accardi-by-the-Sea

children.title: Why aren't there any price tags in the weapon shop?

child.title: Why aren't there any price tags in the weapon shop?
hints: This is a very exclusive establishment. Its patrons would probably be offended by such crass commercialism.
Maybe the old woman behind the counter can help you.
You can ASK THE OLD WOMAN ABOUT anything in the display case.

children.title: Which weapon should I buy?

child.title: Which weapon should I buy?
hints: The best you can afford.
The old woman doesn't haggle.
Don't forget to ask the old woman about the scabbard.

children.title: I only have one zorkmid! Where can I find more?

child.title: I only have one zorkmid! Where can I find more?
hints: You won't find any zorkmids lying around. But those other things you've been picking up might be worth something.
If you think an item may be valuable, SHOW IT TO THE OLD WOMAN to find out how much it's worth. You can then SELL THE ITEM to beef up your supply of zorkmids.
You can also TRADE items you have for items in the display case.

children.title: How do I get into the Guild Hall?

child.title: How do I get into the Guild Hall?
hints: That warning nymph sure is a pest, eh?
You can't get past the warning nymph without help.
Stick around for a few moves. Help is on the way.
The monkey grinder will squash the nymph for you soon after he appears.
Nothing can stop you now (except the monkey grinder).
You can fight the monkey grinder, but survival is unlikely. Wands and scrolls aren't much good against him, either.
Read The Lore and Legends of Quendor.
Did you notice the statistic regarding the literacy rate of monkey grinders?
There is an object in the story that could be dangerous to someone who can't read.
It's in the lighthouse.
Have you noticed the warning plaque on the sea chest?
GIVE THE SEA CHEST TO THE MONKEY GRINDER after he squashes the warning nymph. Now you can WALK INTO THE GUILD HALL.

children.title: What can I do with the hurdy-gurdy?

child.title: What can I do with the hurdy-gurdy?
hints: EXAMINE THE HURDY-GURDY and its various parts before you experiment.
You can turn the crank to the left or right.
Try closing the hurdy-gurdy before turning the crank.
Try pointing the dial at different pictures before turning the crank.
Try putting things into the hurdy-gurdy before you close it and turn the crank.

children.title: The Moors

child.title: The Moors

children.title: Help! An eldritch vapor is stealing my possessions!

child.title: Help! An eldritch vapor is stealing my possessions!
hints: The vapor won't steal anything that you wield or wear.
Whack it a few times with a good weapon. It'll go away.
Once you've gotten rid of the vapor, look around. You'll find your stolen possessions in the moors, scattered but intact.

children.title: The pterodactyl won't let me near. Should I ignore him?

child.title: The pterodactyl won't let me near. Should I ignore him?
hints: Not if you want to finish the story.
If you could heal the pterodactyl's wound, maybe he would trust you.
The Lore and Legends of Quendor mentions a cure for wounds.
You'll find what you need near the Hilltop where the story began.
PICK A WEED from the patch around the billboard at Edge of Storms. You can use it to heal the pterodactyl.

children.title: How do I treat the pterodactyl? He still won't let me near!

child.title: How do I treat the pterodactyl? He still won't let me near!
hints: Extracting the arrow is likely to be painful.
You must put the pterodactyl to sleep before you can treat him. There are two ways to do this, both involving Magick.
One way is to obtain a Wand of Anesthesia. This can be tricky, as the wand's location varies from game to game. If you find the wand, POINT IT AT THE PTERODACTYL for immediate results.
The other method involves the hurdy-gurdy.
One of the dial settings on the hurdy-gurdy produces an especially relaxing effect.
Bring the hurdy-gurdy to the pterodactyl's room. POINT THE DIAL AT THE PICTURE OF AN EAR. CLOSE THE HURDY-GURDY. TURN THE CRANK TO THE RIGHT.
The soothing music will lull the pterodactyl to sleep. GET THE ARROW (yuck). Now RUB THE WEED AGAINST THE WOUND. When the pterodactyl wakes up, you'll have a valuable new friend.

children.title: Why should I want a pterodactyl for a friend?

child.title: Why should I want a pterodactyl for a friend?
hints: He can do something you can't do.
He can fly.
GET ON THE PTERODACTYL. After you've cured him, of course.
His skinny back obviously wasn't meant for riders.
There's a device for supporting riders of skinny backs.
You'll find one in Mizniaport, southwest of the moors.
It's inside the stall.
Once you've figured out how to get the saddle, bring it to the pterodactyl and put it on him. RIDE THE PTERODACTYL. Now you can soar all over the place by saying FLY (or giving him directions)!

children.title: The pterodactyl disappeared! Where did he go?

child.title: The pterodactyl disappeared! Where did he go?
hints: He flew off when you left him alone.
You can call him back with the whistle. I hope you took it with you.

children.title: Is the whistle useful?

child.title: Is the whistle useful?
hints: Definitely. Try blowing the whistle anywhere outdoors.
Try blowing it when the pterodactyl isn't nearby.
You can use the whistle to summon the pterodactyl up to three times. He won't appear if you're near a monster, or anyplace where it would be difficult or dangerous for him to land.

children.title: The winds make navigation a real pain. Is there anything I can do?

child.title: The winds make navigation a real pain. Is there anything I can do?
hints: It would be nice if you knew which way the wind was blowing.
It would be even nicer if you could control the wind.
Read The Lore and Legends of Quendor.
Have you found a compass rose yet?
There's a compass rose growing in the Fields of Frotzen. Refer to the Fields of Frotzen section of the booklet for clues.
If you EXAMINE THE ROSE, you can see which way the wind is blowing from.
To change the wind direction, POINT THE STEM TO THE SOUTH (or towards whichever way you want the wind to blow from). Now you can fly anywhere.

children.title: The Castle

child.title: The Castle

children.title: What's the Magick password that will lower the drawbridge?

child.title: What's the Magick password that will lower the drawbridge?
hints: Ask the pelican.
Insist.
CUT OFF THE PELICAN'S HEAD. That'll teach him to listen!
Password? Drawbridge? Pelican? This isn't Wishbringer.

children.title: Help! I keep getting caught by the Queen!

child.title: Help! I keep getting caught by the Queen!
hints: She's likely to catch anybody she sees.
If she couldn't see you, she might not catch you.
Find a place to hide.
HIDE BEHIND THE BUSH and keep quiet! She'll go away eventually.

children.title: Is the morgia bush good for anything?

child.title: Is the morgia bush good for anything?
hints: You can hide in it. Ouch! (See previous question.) Read The Lore and Legends of Quendor.
Morgia root increases your strength. Try it. You'll like It.

children.title: How do I get the jar?

child.title: How do I get the jar?
hints: The same way the Queen did.
Wait for the Queen to leave. GET OUT OF THE BUSH. OPEN THE STATUE.

children.title: How do I get out of the castle?

child.title: How do I get out of the castle?
hints: The same way you got there.
BLOW THE WHISTLE.

children.title: Mizniaport

child.title: Mizniaport

children.title: Haven't I seen this old woman somewhere before?

child.title: Haven't I seen this old woman somewhere before?
hints: Perhaps, if you've visited another store previously.
EXAMINE THE OLD WOMAN. How curious.

children.title: How do I buy things in the boutique?

child.title: How do I buy things in the boutique?
hints: The same way you buy things everywhere else.
Refer to the questions about the weapon shop for more help.

children.title: Which armor should I buy?

child.title: Which armor should I buy?
hints: The best you can afford.
One item has an unusual description.
EXAMINE THE CLOAK.
If you can afford it, BUY THE CLOAK and bring it to the Magick Shoppe in Gurth City. ASK THE OLD WOMAN ABOUT THE CLOAK.

children.title: Do I need the horseshoe?

child.title: Do I need the horseshoe?
hints: Yes.
PICK UP THE HORSESHOE. It'll come in handy later.

children.title: How do I shoe the unicorn? I can't find any nails!

child.title: How do I shoe the unicorn? I can't find any nails!
hints: There are no nails to be found. Use the red-hot spikes instead.
There aren't any red-hot spikes, either.
You don't need to shoe the unicorn.

children.title: I can't reach the saddle!

child.title: I can't reach the saddle!
hints: There are two ways to get the saddle. Both require Magick.
One way is to obtain a Wand of Levitation. If you find the wand, POINT IT AT THE SADDLE. Then PICK UP THE SADDLE.
The other way is more violent (and fun).
It involves the amulet.
PUT ON THE AMULET and speak its Word of Power. Your increased strength will allow you to BREAK DOWN THE STALL. Then you can GO INTO THE STALL and PICK UP THE SADDLE.

children.title: That unicorn sure looks sad. Isn't there anything I can do for her?

child.title: That unicorn sure looks sad. Isn't there anything I can do for her?
hints: She probably doesn't enjoy being cooped up like that.
There are three (count 'em, three!) ways to free the unicorn. All require the use of Magick.
The first two solutions are the same ones you can use to obtain the saddle. Refer to the previous question for clues.
The third solution involves an object found in the lighthouse.
It's the sea chest.
Have you tried to OPEN THE SEA CHEST? (Don't do it more than once.) The Lore and Legends of Quendor has something to say about unicorns.
SHOW THE SEA CHEST TO THE UNICORN. Note her reaction.
GIVE THE SEA CHEST TO THE UNICORN.

children.title: The Fields of Frotzen

child.title: The Fields of Frotzen

children.title: How do I get past the lightning at Edge of Storms?

child.title: How do I get past the lightning at Edge of Storms?
hints: Somebody above the clouds doesn't like you.
The Implementors dwell above the clouds. You should pay them a visit.
You need to have read the palimpsest in order to continue.
Listen to what the mild-mannered Implementor says when he offers you the goblet?
You can go west from Edge of Storms (or east from Intersection) as long as you're holding the Implementors' goblet.

children.title: How do I catch the butterfly?

child.title: How do I catch the butterfly?
hints: You need a lure.
Insects are attracted to sweet things.
You'll find something sweet on the Ethereal Plane of Atrii.
There's a sweet, sticky coating inside the goblet.
Just bring the goblet to the butterfly's vicinity and WAIT. It won't take long for her to find the sweet coating.

children.title: Is there any way to get a scarecrow?

child.title: Is there any way to get a scarecrow?
hints: No. You don't need to move any scarecrows to complete the story.

children.title: What do I do with the scarecrows?

child.title: What do I do with the scarecrows?
hints: EXAMINE each one of them.
One of the scarecrows is not like the others.
Only one of the scarecrows seems to be doing its job.
Something about the "good" scarecrow is fending off the corbies.
The corbies see something about the "good" scarecrow that you don't.
Read The Lore and Legends of Quendor.
Your color vision is muted while you're in the Fields of Frotzen.
There is an object in the story that enhances colors.
It's the hurdy-gurdy.
Bring the hurdy-gurdy to one of the scarecrows. CLOSE THE HURDY-GURDY.
POINT THE DIAL AT THE PICTURE OF AN EYE. TURN THE CRANK TO THE RIGHT.
You can now discern the color of the rags on each scarecrow.
The corbies don't like the color of the "good" scarecrow. You can use this information to your advantage later.

children.title: How do I get by the corbies blocking off part of the fields?

child.title: How do I get by the corbies blocking off part of the fields?
hints: You can't fight your way through. There are too many.
Have you noticed the scarecrows scattered around the fields?
Have you determined the significance of the scarecrows? If not, refer to the question about the scarecrows before going any further.
If you had something of the correct color, the corbies would let you by.
See the question about the farmhouse and the section about Froon.

children.title: Where'd this farmhouse come from?

child.title: Where'd this farmhouse come from?
hints: Wait around outside until a storm starts brewing.
Maybe the answer is inside, safe from the storm.
GO INTO THE FARMHOUSE. WAIT. Happy landings.

children.title: Froon

child.title: Froon

children.title: How do I polish the giant boot?

child.title: How do I polish the giant boot?
hints: With the giant rag...
that's in the giant bag...
held by the giant hag.
ASK THE GIANT HAG FOR THE GIANT RAG IN THE GIANT BAG.
Rag? Hag? Bag? You don't need to polish the giant boot.

children.title: Nothing is happening here in Froon. What do I do?

child.title: Nothing is happening here in Froon. What do I do?
hints: LOOK UNDER THE HOUSE.
EXAMINE THE FLOWERS.
That's not a flower! That's an inhabitant of Froon.
Wait for the mayor to show up.

children.title: Does it matter which key I take?

child.title: Does it matter which key I take?
hints: Only if you want to finish the story.
Do any of the colors look familiar?
The scarecrows in the Fields of Frotzen are dressed in the same colors as the three keys.
Only one of the scarecrows fends off the corbies.
The corbies stay away from it because they don't like that color.
Take the key that corresponds to the color of the "good" scarecrow.
Now you can fend off corbies, too!

children.title: Gurth

child.title: Gurth

children.title: The street hawker dropped something!

child.title: The street hawker dropped something!
hints: Oh, well. She's gone now.
PICK UP THE FISH CAKE. Quickly!

children.title: This old woman looks awfully familiar.

child.title: This old woman looks awfully familiar.
hints: She may indeed, if you've visited another store previously.

children.title: Is there anything I need to buy in the Magick Shoppe?

child.title: Is there anything I need to buy in the Magick Shoppe?
hints: Many of the items are quite useful. One is essential.
Unfortunately, it's the most expensive item. The hourglass.
It's impossible to afford the hourglass unless you find something incredibly valuable to trade for it.
Such a treasure lies in the jungles of Miznia.
Take a ride on the Skyway and pay attention to the conductor.
You must retrieve the Crocodile's Tear. When you do, SELL THE TEAR TO THE OLD WOMAN. Now you can afford the hourglass.

children.title: Can I do anything at the Shady Wall?

child.title: Can I do anything at the Shady Wall?
hints: You bet.
But only if you have a gray sphere. Refer to the appropriate question for details.

children.title: The Jungles of Miznia

child.title: The Jungles of Miznia

children.title: How do I get into the gondola?

child.title: How do I get into the gondola?
hints: Just GET INTO THE GONDOLA.
It helps if you wait for the conductor to say "All aboard."

children.title: Are the support towers good for anything?

child.title: Are the support towers good for anything?
hints: Of course. They hold up the gondola. They're also a convenient way to visit the jungle.
Read the room description carefully as you pass one of the towers.
There's a maintenance platform near the top of each tower.
JUMP ONTO THE PLATFORM as your gondola passes by one of the towers. Now you can CLIMB DOWN A LADDER and visit the jungle.

children.title: What can I do with the mossy rock?

child.title: What can I do with the mossy rock?
hints: The question is, what will the mossy rock do with you?
It's not really a mossy rock. It's a bloodworm!
It's clobberin' time!

children.title: It's completely dark! What happened?

child.title: It's completely dark! What happened?
hints: Looks like you've fallen into the idol. Hope you brought your lantern.

children.title: Is there any light source besides the lantern?

child.title: Is there any light source besides the lantern?
hints: Yes. One magic item produces a very brief glow of light.
It's the amulet.
PUT ON THE AMULET and speak its Word of Power. The glowing star will provide two moves' worth of illumination.

children.title: Is there anything to do inside the idol?

child.title: Is there anything to do inside the idol?
hints: Reread the room description.
Read The Lore and Legends of Quendor.
The moss on the walls should look familiar.
It's Moss of Mareilon. Use it to boost your dexterity. It can't hurt.

children.title: Why can't I see the secret door in the idol?

child.title: Why can't I see the secret door in the idol?
hints: It's an awfully good secret.
So secret that it doesn't even exist.
Sorry. There is no secret door.

children.title: How do I get back outside of the idol?

child.title: How do I get back outside of the idol?
hints: There are no less than four ways to escape from the idol. All of them involve Magick.
One of the ways involves a wand.
The Wand of Eversion will do the trick.
"Eversion" means "inside out."
POINT THE WAND OF EVERSION AT THE IDOL. You're free!
The other three ways are the same as getting out of the cellar. Just develop the last three clues pertaining to escaping from the Cellar.

children.title: I can see the Crocodile's Tear, but I can't reach it without falling into the idol! This is driving me crazy!

child.title: ...into the idol! This is driving me crazy!
hints: The idol's maw is like a seesaw.
You need something heavier than you to hold down the bottom end.
One of your jungle friends may be able to help.
How about the mother hungus?
You have to get the mother hungus to follow you.
Read The Lore and Legends of Quendor.
If you threaten the baby hungus, his mother will chase you through the jungle!
The hungus is slow. Give her time to catch up. If you're wearing the cloak, take it off... it makes it harder for her to follow you.
Lead the mother hungus to the idol. GET INTO THE MAW. The mother will climb up onto the bottom edge. Now you can climb up and GET THE JEWEL.
Sort of.

children.title: I lost the jewel! How do I get it back?

child.title: I lost the jewel! How do I get it back?
hints: A great, big bottle of laxative might work.
Unfortunately, there's no laxative to be found. Try something else.
There's a wand that can help.
It's the Wand of Eversion.
"Eversion" means "inside out."
POINT THE WAND OF EVERSION AT THE MOTHER HUNGUS.

children.title: Poor widdle baby hungus! Is there any way to rescue him?

child.title: Poor widdle baby hungus! Is there any way to rescue him?
hints: Yes. (Sniff.) To rescue the baby, you must obtain a Wand of Levitation. This can be tricky, as the wand's location varies from game to game.
When you find the wand, POINT IT AT THE BABY HUNGUS.
But don't free the baby before you get the Crocodile's Tear! Otherwise, you won't be able to complete the story.

children.title: What can I do at the waterfall?

child.title: What can I do at the waterfall?
hints: Nothing. It's just scenery.

children.title: Thriff

child.title: Thriff

children.title: How do I stop the hunter from finding the minx?

child.title: How do I stop the hunter from finding the minx?
hints: He might not find her if he didn't know where to look.
He's following her footprints in the snow.
Quick! RUB OUT THE FOOTPRINTS before the hunter arrives.

children.title: Where do I find chocolate truffles?

child.title: Where do I find chocolate truffles?
hints: Read The Lore and Legends of Quendor.
They're not easy to find without help.
One of the creatures in Lore and Legends can help you.
Bring the minx to an oak tree and put her down. WAIT.
PICK UP THE CHOCOLATE TRUFFLE before she eats it herself!
And don't leave the truffle anywhere she can get her paws on it.

children.title: Those truffles don't last very long, do they?

child.title: Those truffles don't last very long, do they?
hints: Nope. The Lore and Legends of Quendor says so.
There is a way to keep truffles fresh.
The clock setting on the hurdy-gurdy will renew the truffles when you turn the crank to the left (if the truffle is inside).
However, they'll start decaying again right away.
There's a way to keep them eternally fresh.
Don't continue unless you've visited the forest north of Gurth.
Have you answered the riddle on the boulder?
Remember what the hollow voice says when you answer the riddle.
DROP THE CHOCOLATE TRUFFLE INTO THE POOL. Or, WALK INTO THE POOL while holding a truffle. It will now remain fresh forever.

children.title: Can I do anything at the Rock Wall?

child.title: Can I do anything at the Rock Wall?
hints: Definitely. But only if you have a gray sphere. Refer to the appropriate question for details.

children.title: Is there anything I can do in the Chapel?

child.title: Is there anything I can do in the Chapel?
hints: Be quiet and pay attention.
SIT DOWN ON THE PEW. Cardinal Toolbox is rather long-winded.
LOOK UNDER THE PEW. Surprise!

children.title: How do I get the reliquary?

child.title: How do I get the reliquary?
hints: You have to earn it.
Listen to the Cardinal's sermon. There may be an opportunity here.
If you save Thriff from the Christmas tree monsters, "anything you ask will be your reward."
Including the reliquary.
After you thwart the Christmas tree monsters, find the Cardinal. ASK THE CARDINAL FOR THE RELIQUARY.

children.title: What is the glyph in the snowy clearing?

child.title: What is the glyph in the snowy clearing?
hints: Listen to Cardinal Toolbox in the chapel.
It's a Glyph of Warding, left by Orkan. It prevents the Christmas tree monsters from entering the village.

children.title: The Christmas tree monsters won't let me past!

child.title: The Christmas tree monsters won't let me past!
hints: They wouldn't be very good monsters if they did, would they?
The Lore and Legends of Quendor is full of useful facts.
You need a caterpillar. (See next question.) Once you've got a caterpillar, show it to the Christmas tree monsters.
Then you'll be able to get by them.

children.title: Where do I find a caterpillar?

child.title: Where do I find a caterpillar?
hints: Where do caterpillars come from?
More precisely, what comes from caterpillars?
Butterflies!
You need to first get the butterfly from the Fields of Frotzen.
Now you need to turn back the clock on the butterfly.
The clock on the hurdy-gurdy that is.
PUT THE GOBLET (along with the butterfly) IN THE GURDY. CLOSE THE GURDY. TURN THE DIAL TO THE CLOCK. TURN THE CRANK TO THE LEFT. OPEN THE GURDY. Abracadabra ... Poof! A caterpillar.

children.title: Is the leaflet useful for anything?

child.title: Is the leaflet useful for anything?
hints: READ THE LEAFLET.
OPEN THE PARCEL.

children.title: What do I do with the little black book?

child.title: What do I do with the little black book?
hints: READ IT. Some of the information in it will prove useful.

children.title: How did that dome get on top of the mountain?

child.title: How did that dome get on top of the mountain?
hints: Somebody who knows a lot about Magick left it there.
Read the little black book in the Laboratory.
Did you LOOK UNDER THE DOME yet?
Orkan cast a yonked girgol spell on the lava to keep it from erupting.

children.title: How do I stop the glyph from melting with the snow?

child.title: How do I stop the glyph from melting with the snow?
hints: You can't. You must find some other way to thwart the Christmas tree monsters.

children.title: How do I thwart the Christmas tree monsters?

child.title: How do I thwart the Christmas tree monsters?
hints: That Glyph of Warding seems to work just fine. But it's going to melt sooner or later. You must inscribe a more permanent Glyph.
LOOK UNDER THE DOME at the Mountain Peak.
You need to free that lava from Orkan's spell.
There is a Magick item that neutralizes Magick.
It's the Dispel Wand.
POINT THE DISPEL WAND AT THE DOME.
Run! The lava will bury you if you don't get out of its path!

children.title: I buried the Christmas trees, but they still trample the village!

child.title: I buried the Christmas trees, but they still trample the village!
hints: Obviously you didn't destroy all of the trees.
The trees aren't the only things you destroyed in the Snowy Clearing.
You also melted the Glyph of Warding.
You need to inscribe another Glyph before the lava cools and the surviving trees trample the village.

children.title: I can't return to the clearing! It's too hot!

child.title: I can't return to the clearing! It's too hot!
hints: If you wait for the lava to cool, then it's too late. You need Magick help to survive that heat.
There is a Magick item that will help you resist heat.
It's found on the third level of the lighthouse.
It's the dust bunny.
When you defeat the dust bunnies, they coalesce into a ring. Take that ring to the Magick Shoppe and SHOW IT TO THE OLD WOMAN.
PUT ON THE RING. Now you can walk onto the hot lava safely.

children.title: I made it to the Lava Flow! Now what?

child.title: I made it to the Lava Flow! Now what?
hints: The lava underfoot is still soft.
It's an ideal drawing medium.
INSCRIBE A GLYPH ON THE GROUND. When the lava cools, you'll have a Glyph of Warding permanently etched into the rock.

children.title: What tool do I need to inscribe a glyph?

child.title: What tool do I need to inscribe a glyph?
hints: Read the black book from the Laboratory.
Did you look inside the mailbox outside the Laboratory?
Did you read the leaflet and open the parcel?
You need the burin to inscribe a glyph. (As in _Spellbreaker_.)

children.title: Where can I study glyphs? I don't know which one to inscribe!

child.title: Where can I study glyphs? I don't know which one to inscribe!
hints: There's one you can study in the Snowy Clearing.
There's another one in the little black book.
Just examining either one is enough.

children.title: Is the thing in the reliquary useful?

child.title: Is the thing in the reliquary useful?
hints: Not by itself. Does it remind you of something you found somewhere else?
Something in the Laboratory on the workbench?
The black hemisphere. EXAMINE THE BLACK HEMISPHERE.
EXAMINE THE WHITE HEMISPHERE.
The peg and the hole go together.
PUT THE PEG INTO THE HOLE.

children.title: What can I do with the gray sphere?

child.title: What can I do with the gray sphere?
hints: EXAMINE THE GRAY SPHERE.
PEER INTO THE GRAY SPHERE.
You need something to make the swirls more intelligible.
You need more intelligence.
Unless you started with a super-intelligent character, you must find ways to boost your intelligence.
A fish cake will help, but it's probably not enough.
The Enlightenment potion will help, but it's probably not enough.
There's one more thing you can do that will boost your intelligence.
Did you ever listen to the bandits in the Rusty Lantern?
You need to obtain the item that they are talking about.
It's a helmet. Stop reading these items until you get it.
PUT ON THE HELMET. Your intelligence goes up!
If you've done all three thing [sic] to boost your intelligence, now you can PEER INTO THE GRAY SPHERE.
One of the visions holds an important clue.
While standing at either the Shady Wall (southwest of Gurth) or the Rock Wall (northwest of Thriff), repeat the Word of Power uttered by the warlock you saw in the vision.
PUSH THE OUTLINE, like the warlock did.

children.title: The Forest

child.title: The Forest

children.title: What does the inscription on the boulder mean?

child.title: What does the inscription on the boulder mean?
hints: It's a riddle.
Don't develop the next hint unless you're really stumped.
Type the word YOUTH and watch what happens.

children.title: How do I get across the bridge?

child.title: How do I get across the bridge?
hints: You can't. Ever. Really. You cannot reach the far side of the bridge by walking across.
There is a way to get off the bridge. Five ways, in fact. Four involve Magick.
The non-Magick way involves the item you found on the bridge.
It's the umbrella.
GET THE UMBRELLA THEN OPEN IT. JUMP.
Three more ways are the same as those for getting out of the cellar.
Just develop the last three clues pertaining to escaping from the Cellar.
The pterodactyl may also be able to help you if you've helped him.
BLOW THE WHISTLE. If you've saddled the pterodactyl and have not used up your three summons, CLIMB ON THE PTERODACTYL and FLY.

children.title: The Ruins

child.title: The Ruins

children.title: Help! I can't kill the undead warrior!

child.title: Help! I can't kill the undead warrior!
hints: Of course not. He's not really alive.
If weapons don't work, perhaps Magick will.
There is a Magick item that can deal with undead creatures.
THROW THE VIAL OF HOLY WATER AT THE UNDEAD WARRIOR.

children.title: Are the weeds at the Glare good for anything?

child.title: Are the weeds at the Glare good for anything?
hints: Read The Lore and Legends of Quendor.
It's spenseweed.

children.title: What is the significance of the arch in the Plaza?

child.title: What is the significance of the arch in the Plaza?
hints: EXAMINE THE ARCH.
There's something with a similar shape elsewhere in the story.
It's in the Magick Shoppe in the display case.
ASK THE OLD WOMAN ABOUT THE HOURGLASS.
Try experimenting with the hourglass near the arch.
Under the arch.
STAND UNDER THE ARCH. TURN OVER THE HOURGLASS.

children.title: How do I get the helmet out of the trench?

child.title: How do I get the helmet out of the trench?
hints: Just REACH INTO THE TRENCH.
Sorry, there's no way you can move the stallion to get the helmet.
Looks as if you'll have to come back later. Much later.

children.title: I don't know exactly where (when?) to dig!

child.title: I don't know exactly where (when?) to dig!
hints: You need to mark the location of the trench.
Some creatures are prized for their ability to dig up things.
Read The Lore and Legends of Quendor.
Minxes aren't known for digging up helmets.
They are able to dig up truffles, though.
Unfortunately, chocolate truffles don't last very long. Refer to the question about truffles to find out how to make them last.
The minx can't dig if the ground is too hard.

Take a truffle to the Pool of Eternal Youth. PUT THE TRUFFLE IN THE POOL. Now take the truffle back in time to the Battleground. DROP THE TRUFFLE INTO THE TRENCH. Now go forward in time with the minx to Desolation. The minx will do the rest.

children.title: Underground

child.title: Underground

children.title: How do I see underground? It's dark.

child.title: How do I see underground? It's dark.
hints: You need a source of light. The lantern, perhaps? Perhaps not.
If you've been to the castle, reflect on the problem for a while. If not, you need to get there before continuing.
Experiment with the jar. And with the mirrors.
Reread the description for the Rock Wall room carefully.
Blow a bubble mirror just inside the Rock Wall.
The mirrors rotate, as if they were on pivots.
From the secret doorway at Rock Wall: GO INSIDE. OPEN THE JAR. TAKE THE CIRCLET. BLOW A BUBBLE. TURN THE MIRROR TO THE SOUTH.
Using a series of mirrors, you can reflect sunlight into any one of the Underground passageways.

children.title: Is there any way to stop the lucksuckers?

child.title: Is there any way to stop the lucksuckers?
hints: Read The Lore and Legends of Quendor.
HIT THE LUCKSUCKER with the best weapons you've got.
Lucksuckers aren't affected by ordinary weapons.
Good luck charms can forestall their attack.
Try showing one of your good luck charms to a lucksucker.
Throw a good luck charm at a lucksucker.

children.title: How do I deal with the lurking presences in the dark?

child.title: How do I deal with the lurking presences in the dark?
hints: You can't see them to fight them without Magick.
Wearing the helmet will enable you to attack them normally.
The grues are the toughest monsters in the game. You need to be well prepared to fight them.
Protected plate mall and a honed elvish sword are the best weapons against the grues.

children.title: What is the shadow in the corner?

child.title: What is the shadow in the corner?
hints: It is unwise to speak of such things.
It's an ur-grue. Consult The Lore and Legends of Quendor for all the terrifying details.

children.title: How do I deal with the shadow?

child.title: How do I deal with the shadow?
hints: Very carefully.
The Lore and Legends of Quendor may shed some light on the matter.
You need to shed some light on the shadow.
Sunlight.
Arrange some mirrors so that a beam of sunlight illuminates the Treasure Chamber. BLOW A BUBBLE in the Chamber. TURN THE MIRROR TO THE EAST.

children.title: I don't want to strangle baby grues! How do I survive the ur-grue's attack?

child.title: I don't want to strangle baby grues! How do I survive the ur-grue's attack?
hints: Uh-oh. Looks as if all your compassion was sucked away. Nobody with an ounce of compassion could strangle a baby ... not even a baby grue.
You didn't accumulate enough compassion during the course of the story to survive the ur-grue's attack.
There are three ways to gain compassion.
Rescuing the minx. (Which you've probably already done.) Releasing the unicorn also gains compassion.
The third way to gain compassion is to rescue the baby hungus by using the levitation wand.

children.title: Look at all that plunder! How do I bring it home?

child.title: Look at all that plunder! How do I bring it home?
hints: Don't you want to gloat over it first?
Don't you want to SEARCH IT?
Oh, my. What have we here?
PICK UP THE COCONUT. And don't let it go!
Congratulations.

children.title: Treasure Locations and Values

child.title: Treasure Locations and Values
child.content:
(Note -- Magick items can also be resold for zorkmids.)

  Treasure               Location                Value
  Silver Ornament        Christmas Trees            2
  Truffles (3)           Under Oak Trees            5
  Gold Doubloon          Crab's Nest               10
  Tiny Crown             On the Crab               20
  Bubble Gum Card        2nd Floor Lighthouse      30
  Sextant                Lamphouse                 30
  Ivory Tusk             Jungle                    40
  Diamond                Snow Wight                50
  Crocodile's Tear       Idol                    1000

children.title: For Your Amusement

child.title: For Your Amusement
child.content:
Have you tried...

asking the old woman (each one) about almost anything?

asking the cook about himself?

pointing the Sayonara wand at the snow wight?

insulting the cruel puppet?

pointing the Levitation wand at the reliquary?

touching people after crossing the bear rug?

opening the umbrella while flying on the pterodactyl?

opening the umbrella indoors?

eating a truffle in front of the minx?

selling a truffle to the old woman?

tasting the sticky coating in the goblet?

opening the chest a second time?

turning the crank on the hurdy-gurdy (12 possibilities) near the old woman?

drinking the potion of forgetfulness? death?
